member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TSliceMode
member.summary: Used in the pin creating functions of IPluginHost to specifiy possible SliceCounts.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TSliceMode.Single
member.summary: The pin can only have one slice.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TSliceMode.Dynamic
member.summary: The pin can have any number of slices.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TComponentMode
member.summary: Used to set the InitialComponentMode in IPluginInfo which specifies the ComponentMode for a plugin when it is being created.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TComponentMode.Hidden
member.summary: The plugins GUI will initially be hidden, only its node is visible.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TComponentMode.InABox
member.summary: The plugins GUI will initially be showing in a box in the patch.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TComponentMode.InAWindow
member.summary: The plugins GUI will initially be showing in its own window.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinVisibility
member.summary: Used in the pin creating functions of IPluginHost to specifiy the initial visibility of the pin. If this is not set to FALSE then the option can be changed by the user via the Inspektor.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinVisibility.False
member.summary: The pin is not visible at all.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinVisibility.OnlyInspector
member.summary: The pin is visible only in the Inspektor

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: The pin is not visible on the node, but space is reserved for it and it appears on mouseover.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinVisibility.True
member.summary: Default. The pin is visible on the node.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinDirection
member.summary: Used to specifiy a pins Direction.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinDirection.Configuration
member.summary: The pin is a ConfigurationPin and as such only accessible via the Inspektor.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinDirection.Input
member.summary: The pin is an input to the node.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TPinDirection.Output
member.summary: The pin is an output from the node.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TLogType.Debug
member.summary: Specifies a debug message.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TLogType.Message

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TLogType.Warning
member.summary: Specifies a warning message.

member.name: F:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.TLogType.Error
member.summary: Specifies an errormessage.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginBase
member.summary: The one single interface a plugin has to implement

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPlugin
member.summary: The one single interface a plugin has to implement

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPlugin.SetPluginHost(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginHost)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost to hand itself over to the plugin. This is where the plugin creates its initial pins.
member.param: Interface to the PluginHost.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPlugin.Configurate(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginConfig)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost before the Evaluate function every frame for every ConfigurationPin that has changed. The ConfigurationPin is handed over as the functions input parameter. This is where a plugin would typically create/delete pins as reaction to the changed value of a ConfigurationPin that specifies the number of pins of a specific type.
member.param: Interface to the ConfigurationPin for which the function is called.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPlugin.Evaluate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost once per frame. This is where the plugin calculates and sets the SliceCounts and Values of its outputs depending on the values of its current inputs.
member.param: The maximum SliceCount of all of the plugins inputs, which would typically be used to adjust the SliceCounts of all outputs accordingly.

member.name: P:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPlugin.AutoEvaluate
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost only once during initialization to find out if this plugin needs to be evaluated every frame even if there is not output connected. Typically this can return FALSE as long as the plugin doesn't have a special reason for doing otherwise.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginConnections
member.summary: Optional interface to be implemented on a plugin that needs to know when one of its pins is connected or disconnected

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginConnections.ConnectPin(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginIO)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost for every input or output that is being connected. This is typically useful for NodeIO Inputs that can cache a reference to the upstream interface at this place instead of getting the reference every frame in Evaluate.
member.param: Interface to the pin for which the function is called.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginConnections.DisconnectPin(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginIO)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost for every input or output that is being disconnected. This is typically useful for NodeIO Inputs that can set a cached reference to the upstream interface to null at this place.
member.param: Interface to the pin for which the function is called.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginFeedbackLoop
member.summary: Optional interface to be implemented on a plugin that wants to allow feedback loops.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginFeedbackLoop.OutputRequiresInputEvaluation(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginIO,VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginIO)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost for every input/output pair to decide whether or not the input needs to be evaluated before the output can be validated.
member.param: The input pin.
The output pin.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXResource
member.summary: Optional interface to be implemented on a plugin that deals with DirectX resources like Meshes, Textures, Layers...

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXResource.UpdateResource(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginOut,SlimDX.Direct3D9.Device)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost every frame for every device. Therefore a plugin should only do device specific operations here and still keep node specific calculations in the Evaluate call.
member.param: Interface to the pin for which the function is called.
Pointer to the device on which the resources is to be updated.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXResource.DestroyResource(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginOut,SlimDX.Direct3D9.Device,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost whenever a resource for a specific pin needs to be destroyed on a specific device. This is also called when the plugin is destroyed, so don't dispose dxresources in the plugins destructor/Dispose()
member.param: Interface to the pin for which the function is called.
Pointer to the device on which the resources is to be destroyed.
If True only unmanaged DirectX resources need to be destroyed.

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXMesh
member.summary: Optional interface to be implemented on a plugin that deals with DirectX Meshes

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXMesh.GetMesh(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IDXMeshOut,SlimDX.Direct3D9.Device)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost everytime a mesh is accessed via a pin on the plugin. This is called from the PluginHost from within DirectX BeginScene/EndScene, therefore the plugin shouldn't be doing much here other than handing back the right mesh.
member.param: Interface to the pin via which the mesh is accessed.
The device for which the mesh is accessed.

The device for which the texture is accessed.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXTexture2.GetTexture(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IDXTextureOut,SlimDX.Direct3D9.Device,System.Int32)

member.name: T:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXLayer
member.summary: Optional interface to be implemented on a plugin that deals with DirectX Layers

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXLayer.SetStates
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost everytime it needs to update its StateBlock. Here the plugin must specify all States it will set during IPluginDXLayer.Render via calls to IDXRenderStateIn's and IDXSamplerStateIn's functions.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IPluginDXLayer.Render(VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IDXLayerIO,SlimDX.Direct3D9.Device)
member.summary: Called by the PluginHost everytime the plugin is supposed to render itself. This is called from the PluginHost from within DirectX BeginScene/EndScene, therefore the plugin shouldn't be doing much here other than some drawing calls.

member.name: M:VVVV.PluginInterfaces.V1.IValueConfig.SetSubType(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used to set the SubType of a Value pin, which is a set of limitations to the pins value range, used by the GUI to guide the user to insert correct values. Note though that this does not prevent a user from setting "wrong" values on a pin. Ultimately each node is responsible for dealing with all possible inputs correctly. Should only be called once immediately after the pin has been created in IPlugin.SetPluginHost.
member.param: Minimum of the Values range.
Maximum of the Values range.
StepSize used when scrolling the value up or down via the GUI.
The Value the pin is initialized with and can be reset to at any time.
Hint to the GUI that this Value is a bang.
Hint to the GUI that this is a toggling Value.
Hint to the GUI that this is an integer Value.
